TextSection.Contents: Coloboma of superior eyelid is a rare developmental defect during embryogenesis characterized by a typically unilateral partial or full-thickness variably sized defect of the superior eyelid ranging from a small notch to complete absence of the entire lid which is commonly triangular in shape (with base at eyelid margin) and located on the medial third of the lid. It can occur isolated associated with other anomalies (e.g. ocular/orbital and facial) or as part of a syndrome.
